content:
• Wednesday, August 29, 2012
  • LYB

    LyondellBasell (NYSE:LYB) will replace Sears (SHLD) in the S&P 500 after the close of...

    LyondellBasell (NYSE:LYB) will replace Sears (SHLD) in the S&P 500 after the close of trading next Tuesday. Sears' public float has been well below the 50% threshold for inclusion for an extended period of time and is no longer considered representative of the index, S&P says. SHLD -3%, LYB +3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 11 Comments
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE -10.7%) crashed to a new low of $0.28 today in the absence of major news....

    A123 Systems (AONE -10.7%) crashed to a new low of $0.28 today in the absence of major news. Shares are now 40% below the level they traded at before A123 announced a giant and controversial financing deal with China's Wanxiang Group. The Street may be worried the deal will fall through due to political concerns, or will be dilutive to the point where existing shareholders are left with very little.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 8 Comments
  • OXM

    More on Oxford Industries (NYSE:OXM): Q2 beats across the board on a 15% jump in total revenues....

    More on Oxford Industries (NYSE:OXM): Q2 beats across the board on a 15% jump in total revenues. The stock is trading lower after hours however, as the company comes up short in its FY12 guidance. It affirms its previously issued guidance range of $2.85 to $2.95 and net sales of $850M to $865M, but the Street is at $2.99 per share in earnings on sales of $866M. Shares -8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +6.7%) steadily moved higher today after announcing a $15M, 5-year...

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +6.7%) steadily moved higher today after announcing a $15M, 5-year contract to provide digital cable distribution software and services for Indian satellite broadcast infrastructure services firm NSPTL. KIT had closed yesterday near an all-time low - shares have been stung by poor earnings, management turmoil, and uncertainty related to an HQ move from Prague to New York. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • GWAY

    Greenway (NYSE:GWAY): FQ4 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $36.4M (+24% Y/Y) beats by...

    Greenway (NYSE:GWAY): FQ4 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $36.4M (+24% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • BNS

    Scotiabank (NYSE:BNS) agrees to buy the Canadian unit of ING for $3.1B, with the net investment...

    Scotiabank (NYSE:BNS) agrees to buy the Canadian unit of ING for $3.1B, with the net investment (after deducting excess capital at ING Bank of Canada) footing to $1.9B. To fund the purchase, Scotiabank will undertake a secondary of 29M shares at $52. BNS -2.1%, ING +1.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 3 Comments
  • P

    More on Pandora's FQ2: FQ3 guidance is for revenue of $115M-$118M and EPS of $0.00-$0.01,...

    More on Pandora's FQ2: FQ3 guidance is for revenue of $115M-$118M and EPS of $0.00-$0.01, largely above a consensus of $114.4M and $0.00. FY13 guidance is for revenue of $425M-$432M and EPS of -$0.04 to -$0.08, above a consensus of $424.2M and -$0.12. Mobile revenue was $59.2M, +86% Y/Y and now 58% of total, evidence monetization is improving. Royalty costs +80% Y/Y, above revenue growth and 60% of sales. P +10.9% AH. 48.9% of the float was shorted on Aug. 15, expect some covering. (PR) (July listener data)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 6 Comments
  • TIVO

    More on TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO): Q2 beats across the board on fewer than anticipated losses. Service...

    More on TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO): Q2 beats across the board on fewer than anticipated losses. Service & Technology revenue +10% Y/Y. Total subscriptions grew by 230,000 over the quarter. Comcast offering shows early positive results in Boston and San Francisco, with additional market roll-outs to follow. Additionally, SAC Capital discloses a bigger position in the company, upping its stake to 5.18%, from 2.4M to 6.4M shares.  Shares +5.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • VRA

    Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA): Q2 EPS of $0.33 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $123M (+18.5% Y/Y) beats...

    Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA): Q2 EPS of $0.33 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $123M (+18.5% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares -11.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 2 Comments
  • OXM

    Oxford Industries (NYSE:OXM): Q2 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $207M (+15% Y/Y) beats...

    Oxford Industries (NYSE:OXM): Q2 EPS of $0.65 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $207M (+15% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares -8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • TIVO

    TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO): Q2 EPS of -$0.23 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $54.1M (+10% Y/Y) in-line....

    TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO): Q2 EPS of -$0.23 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $54.1M (+10% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • P

    Pandora Media (NYSE:P): Q2 EPS of $0.00 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $101.3M (+51% Y/Y) in-line....

    Pandora Media (NYSE:P): Q2 EPS of $0.00 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $101.3M (+51% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +8.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • CYBX

    Cyberonics (CYBX +7.2%) shares hit an all-time high after reporting the better-than-expected FQ1...

    Cyberonics (CYBX +7.2%) shares hit an all-time high after reporting the better-than-expected FQ1 results, which prompts an upgrade from Canaccord to Buy from Hold. The firm says "our previous concerns about the impact of a competitive drug entering the market and a slowdown in replacement sales have not played out to our pessimistic expectations."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate (LGF +4%) gets an order from FX Network for another 90 episodes of Charlie Sheen's...

    Lions Gate (LGF +4%) gets an order from FX Network for another 90 episodes of Charlie Sheen's new comedy show, "Anger Management." The order was an automatic one under the contract between the two after the show exceeded ratings thresholds in episodes 3-10.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • GALT

    Galectin Therapeutics ((GALT -7.4%) slides after naming Harold H. Shlevin as the company's new...

    Galectin Therapeutics ((GALT -7.4%) slides after naming Harold H. Shlevin as the company's new COO as of October 1, 2012. Mr.Shlevin succeeds Maureen Foley, one of the company's co-founders, who served as its COO and corporate secretary.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU -5.5%) slumps after Barclays lowers its PT to $153 from $189. Like others, the firm...

    Baidu (BIDU -5.5%) slumps after Barclays lowers its PT to $153 from $189. Like others, the firm is worried about the impact of Qihoo's (QIHU +2%) new search engine, and predicts the engine will impact Baidu's 2013 Chinese search traffic and revenue shares by 6% and 2%, respectively. Nonetheless, Barclays, which has struck a bullish tone on Baidu since launching coverage last October, thinks the company will remain the dominant player in Chinese search.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP +4.4%) shares power higher after the retailer rolls out its second round of...

    J.C. Penney (JCP +4.4%) shares power higher after the retailer rolls out its second round of shops as part of CEO Ron Johnson's transformation, as Liz Clairborne, IZOD for men and jcp brand shops (one each for men and women) will officially launch Sept. 1. Nearly 100 such shops are planned to be included within its stores over the next few years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 7 Comments
  • GENE

    Shares of Australian diagnostic firm Genetic Technologies (GENE +33%) are ripping today on the...

    Shares of Australian diagnostic firm Genetic Technologies (GENE +33%) are ripping today on the back of a new bullish report issued by Australian investment bank Lodge Partner, starting the shares with a Buy and an aggressive $17 price target (that would make it a four-bagger from current levels). The firm says BREVAGen, GENE's key diagnostic product, is regaining momentum, noting that H2 sales rose 230% over H1, and it expects that trend to continue.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • YELP

    Well, this is a far cry from what happened with Facebook and Angie's List. Yelp (YELP +24.4%) is...

    Well, this is a far cry from what happened with Facebook and Angie's List. Yelp (YELP +24.4%) is skyrocketing on lockup expiration day, as shorts who profited during the company's recent selloff rush to cover. 5M shares have already been traded, or more than 5x Yelp's average daily volume. It looks as if the handful of VCs and insiders who own nearly 85% of outstanding shares aren't in a hurry to sell, at least for now. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 6 Comments
  • SXL

    Sunoco Logistics (SXL +4.2%) is initiated at Outperform with a $53 target by Robert W. Baird,...

    Sunoco Logistics (SXL +4.2%) is initiated at Outperform with a $53 target by Robert W. Baird, which says SXL could be used as an acquiring entity once it joins the Energy Transfer family. The firm expects the acquirer to boost distributions to increase partnership cash flow and drive unitholder value. Also started at Outperform: ETE, PAA. Started at Neutral: ETP, PNG, OKS.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (APKT +5.7%) is shooting higher for the second day in a row (previous) - today's...

    Acme Packet (APKT +5.7%) is shooting higher for the second day in a row (previous) - today's rally has reportedly been stoked by M&A speculation. A heavy short interest and a depressed stock price make for a volatile mix.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • SHLDQ

    Sears (SHLD +2.9%) secures board approval of a rights offering allowing the retailer to move...

    Sears (SHLD +2.9%) secures board approval of a rights offering allowing the retailer to move ahead with the spinoff of its remaining Hometown and certain hardware stores, and sets Sept. 7 as the record date for the distribution.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • SPPI

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI +4.6%) says the FTC has cleared its acquisition of Allos...

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI +4.6%) says the FTC has cleared its acquisition of Allos Therapeutics (ALTH +1.1%). SPPI has been looking to boost its hematology franchise, and has been chasing ALTH over most of the summer in pursuit of its lymphoma drug Folotyn. The tender offer for Allos shares is slated to expire at 5pm EST on September 4, 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 3 Comments
  • LINC

    For-profit educator Lincoln Educational Services' (LINC -7.1%) enrollment challenges and recent...

    For-profit educator Lincoln Educational Services' (LINC -7.1%) enrollment challenges and recent announcement of seven campus closures lead Oppenheimer to cut its rating on the stock to Perform from Outperform. "Enrollment pressure appears likely to persist through year-end," the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • SEE

    Sealed Air (SEE +8.4%) tops the S&P leader board after announcing the retirement of CEO...

    Sealed Air (SEE +8.4%) tops the S&P leader board after announcing the retirement of CEO William Hickey effective March 2013 to be replaced by long-time Dow Chemical exec Jerome Peribere. Maintaining its Buy rating, Jefferies says "the urgency level has clearly picked up, and with asset sales on the horizon and W.R. potentially emerging soon... shares are biased to the upside."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • MAKO

    Shares of MAKO Surgical (MAKO +8.8%) trade up on the back of strong sales results from British...

    Shares of MAKO Surgical (MAKO +8.8%) trade up on the back of strong sales results from British supplier Corin Group (OTC:CNGHF) overnight. Corin says H1 sales rose 15% to £25.0m, an increase of 13% on a constant currency basis, due in large part to heavy sales to MAKO. Traders are also speculating that a short squeeze might be underway as well, considering the company’s current trading float is over 30% short.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • REX

    Rex American Resources (REX -2.4%) reports FQ2 EPS of $0.10 vs. $0.25 in the year-ago period....

    Rex American Resources (REX -2.4%) reports FQ2 EPS of $0.10 vs. $0.25 in the year-ago period. REX had enjoyed soaring revenues in recent quarters thanks to acquisitions and higher ethanol and dried distiller grain prices, but more recently the industry's profitability has been hit by lower crush spread margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • ETN

    Eaton (ETN -1.5%) slips after MKM Partners cuts the shares to Neutral on valuation, citing...

    Eaton (ETN -1.5%) slips after MKM Partners cuts the shares to Neutral on valuation, citing earnings risk stemming from its China hydraulics, NAFTA truck and an imperfect transition from industrial to commercial-led growth in Electrical Americas.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -5.7%) falls hard after Pac Crest cuts its estimates in response to JA Solar...

    First Solar (FSLR -5.7%) falls hard after Pac Crest cuts its estimates in response to JA Solar and Yingli's disappointing Q2 reports. Though still down on the year, First Solar has been one of this summer's best performers, thanks to a strong Q2 report and growing investor confidence that the company's new focus on projects instead of module sales will pay off. Update: Eric Savitz claims Pac Crest didn't cut its estimates today, as was reported by The Fly on the Wall.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 9 Comments
  • VLO

    Valero Energy (VLO -1.1%) leads a retreat across much of the oil sector as Hurricane Isaac...

    Valero Energy (VLO -1.1%) leads a retreat across much of the oil sector as Hurricane Isaac leaves behind less damage to the Gulf Coast's energy industry than first feared. Among refiners: COP -0.2%, TSO -1%. Big E&Ps: XOM -0.2%, CVX -0.5%, MRO -1.1%. Oilfield services: RIG -1.5%, HAL -1.2%, SLB -0.7%. Explorers: APA -0.3%, APC -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK -5.9%) is selling off again today. A less-than-flattering WSJ article about the early...

    Nokia (NOK -5.9%) is selling off again today. A less-than-flattering WSJ article about the early U.S. uptake seen by Windows Phone (NASDAQ:MSFT) could be playing a role. An AT&T reseller claimed the Lumia 900 only made up 2% of its sales, even though profits on 900 sales are higher than for the iPhone or Galaxy S III, and a T-Mobile reseller claimed WP devices made up just 3% of its sales. The column also notes developer reluctance to write for WP in the absence of a large user base. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 20 Comments
  • VRTX

    The FDA warns that the children taking Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -1.5%) cystic fibrosis...

    The FDA warns that the children taking Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -1.5%) cystic fibrosis treatment Kalydeco are at risk of developing cataracts. Kalydeco is used to treat a subset of cystic fibrosis patients, roughly 4% of the 30k patients here in the States.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 4 Comments
  • GCO

    Genesco (GCO +2.5%) moves up this morning after its Q2 beat on all counts. Net earnings swung to...

    Genesco (GCO +2.5%) moves up this morning after its Q2 beat on all counts. Net earnings swung to a profit as the seller of hats and footwear posted stronger sales and fewer one-time charges. The company also unveiled a new $75M stock repurchase program and raises its outlook for FY12. It now expects to earn between $4.88 to $5 per share and same-store sales growth to come in around 4%, the high end of former estimates of 3% to 4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • BPT

    When the grasping for yield goes bad: BP Prudhoe Bay Royalty Trust (BPT -5.9%) adds to recent...

    When the grasping for yield goes bad: BP Prudhoe Bay Royalty Trust (BPT -5.9%) adds to recent losses, now off 27% in 2 weeks. The entire royalty trust sector has been shaken of late thanks to payout cuts at several (HGT-OLD, SJT, DOM), and the idea prices for these popular income plays have gotten far ahead of what they could ever pay out.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 24 Comments
  • ANGI

    Angie's List (ANGI +6.1%) pops following an upgrade to Outperform from Oppenheimer. The firm...

    Angie's List (ANGI +6.1%) pops following an upgrade to Outperform from Oppenheimer. The firm notes shares had fallen 32% since a lockup expiration ended on Aug. 14, estimates Angie's sales can grow at a 50% annual clip from 2011-14, and notes shares are trading at just 2x EV/sales, while peers trade at much higher multiples. (Barrington)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • BBY

    A Best Buy (BBY -1.8%) buyout is unlikely, Oppenheimer's Brian Nagel writes, even though the...

    A Best Buy (BBY -1.8%) buyout is unlikely, Oppenheimer's Brian Nagel writes, even though the situation is fluid and a deal is feasible. Ample cash flow and a still healthy balance sheet suggest BBY could support the added leverage associated with an LBO, he says, but potential PE buyers likely will be scared away by a declining business model.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 3 Comments
  • YELP

    There's no guarantee the move will last, but Yelp (YELP +8%) is up sharply in early trading on...

    There's no guarantee the move will last, but Yelp (YELP +8%) is up sharply in early trading on the day of its giant lockup expiration. Shares had been hammered in the weeks leading up to the expiration, and 21.8% of Yelp's float was shorted as of Aug. 15.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 2 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +4.3%) continues its recent rise after shares are upgraded to Buy from Hold at...

    Molycorp (MCP +4.3%) continues its recent rise after shares are upgraded to Buy from Hold at Gabelli, which cites the recent financing to provide liquidity through H1 2013 and hitting milestones to get Phase 1 production online on time and on budget. Although rare earth prices remain weak, the firm says much of the risk already is reflected in the share price.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 4 Comments
  • P

    Pandora (P +2.2%) trades higher ahead of this afternoon's FQ2 report. Shares have been...

    Pandora (P +2.2%) trades higher ahead of this afternoon's FQ2 report. Shares have been range-bound this summer after soaring due to to the guidance accompany Pandora's FQ1 report. The monetization of Pandora's mobile radio listening will be in focus today. The company received semi-favorable news yesterday when growing rival Spotify reported an FY12 loss of $56.9M to go with revenue of $235.5M. Soaring content costs, something Pandora is no stranger to, played a big role.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • ARQL

    ArQule (NASDAQ:ARQL) -19.4% premarket after the biotech company is told by its Asian partner...

    ArQule (NASDAQ:ARQL) -19.4% premarket after the biotech company is told by its Asian partner that it has temporarily suspended patient enrollment in its ongoing Phase 3 Attention trial on the recommendation of a safety review committee in Japan about reports of suspected cases of interstitial lung disease in the study.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • JASO

    More on JA Solar's Q2: Poor results blamed on "unfavorable pricing environment" (many solar...

    More on JA Solar's Q2: Poor results blamed on "unfavorable pricing environment" (many solar firms can sympathize). Gross margin edged higher to 4.8% from Q1's 2.1%, but still remains at depressed levels. Modules made up 60% of revenue and 55% of shipments (record highs). Company now expects 2012 cell/module shipments of 1.5GW-1.8GW, below prior guidance of 1.8GW-2GW. Expects Q3 shipments of 350MW-370MW, below Q2's 418MW. JASO -9.4%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • TEAR

    TearLab (NASDAQ:TEAR) +6.2% premarket after Canaccord Genuity initiates coverage with a Buy...

    TearLab (NASDAQ:TEAR) +6.2% premarket after Canaccord Genuity initiates coverage with a Buy rating a $6 price target, noting the company offers the first point of care instrument that can quantitatively measure and diagnose dry eye disease. The firm says U.S. market potential includes 50,000 eye specialists who see on average six dry eye patients per day, equaling a $1.8B opportunity.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures show vague stirrings of life after the Q2 GDP upgrade despite it...

    Market preview: Stock futures show vague stirrings of life after the Q2 GDP upgrade despite it all being fairly expected, with the S&P benchmark +0.1%. Even further strong hints from Mario Draghi that the ECB is set for bondbuying fails to set too many juices flowing. WellPoint +4.55% after its CEO resigns, while Joy Global is -3% following earnings. Later: Pending Home Sales, Fed's Beige Book
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • ANTM

    The sudden departure of WellPoint (WLP) CEO Angela Braly isn’t likely to endanger the...

    The sudden departure of WellPoint (WLP)CEO Angela Braly isn’t likely to endanger the health insurer's $4.5B deal for Amerigroup (AGP). Several analysts say the recently sped-up timeline WLP announced, which has the deal closing in Q4 rather than early next year, was a positive signal; some even suggest AGP CEO Jim Carlson as a potential replacement for Braly. WLP +4.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • JOSB

    Premarket gainers: JOSB +14%. TEAR +8%. MCP +6%. TFM +5%. Losers: ARQL -26%. WCRX -22%. DY -17%....

    Premarket gainers: JOSB +14%. TEAR +8%. MCP +6%. TFM +5%.
    Losers: ARQL -26%. WCRX -22%. DY -17%. JASO -9%. FRO -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • JOSB

    More on Jos. A. Bank Clothiers' (NASDAQ:JOSB) Q2: Comp-store sales rose 6.1%. The direct...

    More on Jos. A. Bank Clothiers' (NASDAQ:JOSB) Q2: Comp-store sales rose 6.1%. The direct marketing segment, which consists of the Internet and catalog call centers, rose 39.3%. Says Q3 started out positively. Plans to open 45-50 stores each in fiscal 2012 and 2013. JOSB +13.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • FRO

    More on Frontline's (NYSE:FRO) Q2: After reporting a loss of $0.31 per basic share, the company...

    More on Frontline's (NYSE:FRO) Q2: After reporting a loss of $0.31 per basic share, the company will not pay a dividend. Following last year's restructuring, operating fleet is reduced to 48 vessels from 58. Based on results achieved so far, Q3 results are expected to be "significantly worse" than in Q2. FRO -7.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 AM

  • A bit of excitement comes out of Norway where the Norges Bank holds its benchmark rate at 1.5%....

    A bit of excitement comes out of Norway where the Norges Bank holds its benchmark rate at 1.5%. The move was supposedly expected, but the euro promptly plunges against the krone, suggesting someone believed the bank was going to cut. The euro also gives up a few pips vs. the greenback, -0.2% to $1.2540.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • FRO

    Frontline (NYSE:FRO): Q2 EPS of -$0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $219.4M (-19.5% Y/Y). Shares...

    Frontline (NYSE:FRO): Q2 EPS of -$0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $219.4M (-19.5% Y/Y). Shares -6% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 AM

  • European stocks open mostly flat to lower as investors await not just Jackson Hole, but also an...

    European stocks open mostly flat to lower as investors await not just Jackson Hole, but also an ECB meeting a week tomorrow, when the bank might announce some bond buying. Or not. Euro Stoxx 50 -0.1%, London -0.3%, Paris -0.2%, Frankfurt flat, Milan +0.1%, Madrid flat.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 AM

  • Asian shares are mixed as some in the market lower their expectations about what Ben Bernanke...

    Asian shares are mixed as some in the market lower their expectations about what Ben Bernanke might say at Jackson Hole. "Bernanke may use the opportunity to highlight the limitations of what central banks can do. Thus, there is a risk that markets will react with disappointment," SocGen says. Japan +0.4%, Hong Kong flat, China -0.8%, India -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 AM
